{"step_by_step_thinking": "Cherry red spot is seen in central retinal artery occlusion (CRAO) and is described as a reddish area at the center of the macula surrounded by retinal opacification. Hollenhorst plaque, on the other hand, is seen in the retinal blood vessels and is caused by an embolus lodged within the retinal vessel, usually originating from an atheromatous plaque in a more proximal vessel, such as the internal carotid artery. Based on this information, the correct answer is A. CRAO.", "answer_choice": "A"}
